message.content:
cs.MA, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.RO 

This paper is about modeling the formation of social conventions in multi-agent populations using a novel Control-based Reinforcement Learning architecture. The paper focuses on the Distributed Adaptive Control (DAC) theory and applies it to a multi-agent game-theoretic task. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.MA (Multiagent Systems). The paper also uses reinforcement learning and artificial intelligence techniques, which makes cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the optimization of long-term rewards, which is a topic in machine learning and falls under cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also deals with control and learning in multi-agent systems, which is related to cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper applies the proposed architecture to a game-theoretic task, which is related to cs.RO (Robotics).
